svcs003 Dimensional Watch
Rarity: Rare
Looking for Inventory Management? Please Login w/ "Remember Me?" option selected.
Dimensional Watch
EQUIP: ANY. UNEQUIP: DROP. EFFECT: Phasing/Teleport. // When this character hits an opposing character, if no character has been placed this turn, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Place another friendly character with the Spider-Man Family keyword adjacent. Light Object.
5 Points
Trade Dimensional Watch Want Dimensional Watch

Remy LeBoat
Almost, but it would seem to me the relevant thing is that no action can interrupt another; so yeah, both effects are possible until the player chooses one - once either the watch or call-in has been chosen, it must continue to resolution, at which point the one not chosen becomes illegal, as a character has now been placed.
October 17, 2020
Bobcat2022
[QUOTE=mc268;12082045]To clarify, you can’t use the watch trait call in and a chase from this set’s spider verse call in during the same turn.[/QUOTE] Right: you can’t have one character use the watch and then later in the same turn have another character use the (latest) CIHFTSV trait, nor vice-versa, because both specify “if no other character has been placed.” I misread the thread, and I’m sort of accidentally making a separate point: what if you have one character use both? Equip Miles Miles West with the watch, he hits, both effects check for “other character has been placed,” none have, so both effects trigger. Then both effects resolve after resolutions (active player’s choice of order), and two Spider-Man Family figures are placed. I’m not saying it’s an omg broken loophole hax, I’m just wondering if I’ve broadly got the whole thing correct.
October 17, 2020
mc268
I think their point was that the wording of the watch, and the spider-verse trait found in this set both say “if no other character has been placed this turn” so you couldn’t use them. In my comment earlier I had initially mentioned you could, as I only played Gwen with characters who had an older version of the trait without this stipulation. To clarify, you can’t use the watch trait call in and a chase from this set’s spider verse call in during the same turn. You can use the watch call in, and one of the superior foes spider verse call ins in the same turn, assuming you use the watch first.

That the trait and the effect both check “have other character(s) been placed” at the time of the [I]hit[/I], triggering both effects... which do not check for other-characters-placement at the time of the roll or the placement (both after resolutions)? October 5, 2020
mc268
[QUOTE=Darkheart;12078904]Don't both the Spiderverse trait and the wristwatch both say "if no other characters have been placed this turn .."?[/QUOTE] I just checked, on the new set of chases, yes they both have that wording, however on the superior foes figures, and the Scarlet Spider OP kit figure from 2017 it just says “once per turn for all characters with this trait” So, my specific example, from a game I played works, and it works for the older Spiders, but not any of the new chases. Kinda similar to them removing automatically breaking away from the symbiote traits.

mc268
Really good with Gwen, Miles and Miguel do to them having powers based on move actions. It’s also worth noting that this trait can be used in addition to the spider-verse trait, assuming you use this one first. You could have Gwen hit someone, then roll to call in Scarlet Spider, have him hit, roll for Spider-Verse to call in someone as well.
